com.cloudera.oryx.als.common.candidate

Class LocationSensitiveHashFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.als.common.candidate.LocationSensitiveHashFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CandidateFilter

    public final class LocationSensitiveHashFilter
extends Object
implements CandidateFilter
    A CandidateFilter based on location-sensitive hashing, which chooses a set of candidate items to consider by filtering out items that are unlikely to make good recommendations.
    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Method Detail

      • getCandidateIterator

        public Collection<Iterator<LongObjectMap.MapEntry<float[]>>> getCandidateIterator(float[][] userVectors)
        Specified by:
        getCandidateIterator in interface CandidateFilter
        Parameters:
        userVectors - user feature vector(s) for which recommendations are being made. This may or may not influence which items are returned. Use StringLongMapping.toLong(String) to find the numeric internal ID for a given string ID.
        Returns:
        a set of items most likely to be a good recommendation for the given users. These are returned as item ID / vector pairs (LongObjectMap's MapEntry). They are returned as an Iterator, and not just one, but potentially many. If several are returned, then the caller can process the Iterators in parallel for speed.
